Message.Title: And this just in...
Message.Msg: ... Tampa, Florida (Routers) Chris Christie to Deliver GOP Convention Keynote New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie has been selected to deliver the keynote address at the Republican National Convention later this month in Tampa. Party leaders announced the decision on Tuesday by saying, “We selected Governor Christie to help overcome the impression people have that we’re nothing but a bunch of stodgy, old, white fat-cats.” While the Republican National Committee is busy adding numerous planks to the final party platform for the convention to accommodate the Tea Party, construction workers (non-union, of course) in the convention hall in Tampa are busy adding numerous, additional (weight-bearing) planks to the actual stage platform to accommodate Governor Christie.
SAFETY FIRST! (Old T slogan)

Cut the schoolyard name-calling. Address the issue at hand. Why are all these projects funded in the first place? How many of them do you think really have a positive impact on our economy or strength as a nation? Let’s see how really smart your collective Ricky/Echo consortium isn’t. How many of them are simply pet pork projects that some lobbyists paid to have a member of Congress create? We need to fix Congress; the only problem is that with the rules of behavior that Congress has set up for themselves, they are the only ones that can change Congress. That is a dead end, they have the country by the short hairs, and they know it.

Message.Title: Abbott and Costello
Message.Msg: COSTELLO: I want to talk about the unemployment rate in America. ABBOTT: Good Subject. Terrible Times. It's 8%. COSTELLO: That many people are out of work? ABBOTT: No, that's 15%. COSTELLO: You just said 8%. ABBOTT: 8% Unemployed. COSTELLO: Right 8% out of work. ABBOTT: No, that's 15%. COSTELLO: Okay, so it's 15% unemployed. ABBOTT: No, that's 8%... COSTELLO: WAIT A MINUTE. Is it 8% or 15%? ABBOTT: 8% are unemployed. 15% are out of work. COSTELLO: IF you are out of work you are unemployed. ABBOTT: No, you can't count the "Out of Work" as the unemployed. You have to look for work to be unemployed. COSTELLO: BUT THEY ARE OUT OF WORK!!! ABBOTT: No, you miss my point. COSTELLO: What point? ABBOTT: Someone who doesn't look for work, can't be counted with those who look for work. It wouldn't be fair. COSTELLO: To whom? ABBOTT: The unemployed. COSTELLO: But they are ALL out of work. ABBOTT: No, the unemployed are actively looking for work. Those who are out of work stopped looking. They gave up. And, if you give up, you are no longer in the ranks of the unemployed. COSTELLO: So if you're off the unemployment roles, that would count as less unemployment? ABBOTT: Unemployment would go down. Absolutely! COSTELLO: The unemployment just goes down because you don't look for work? ABBOTT: Absolutely it goes down. That's how you get to 8%. Otherwise it would be 15%. You don't want to read about 15% unemployment, do ya? COSTELLO: That would be frightening.. ABBOTT: Absolutely. COSTELLO: Wait, I got a question for you. That means there are two ways to bring down the unemployment number? ABBOTT: Two ways is correct. COSTELLO: Unemployment can go down if someone gets a job? ABBOTT: Correct. COSTELLO: And unemployment can also go down if you stop looking for a job? ABBOTT: Bingo. COSTELLO: So there are two ways to bring unemployment down, and the easier of the two is to just stop looking for work. ABBOTT: Now you're thinking like an economist. COSTELLO: I don't even know what the hell I just said! ABBOTT: Now you're thinking like a politician.

Ryan looks like Reagan, he acts like him also. Only on steroids. I don't think Barry was ready for this. He was silent for 3 days, trying to formulate a response. He sent Biden out today, speaking to a mainly minority audience. Plugs actually said, if these two get in (Romney & Ryan), Banks will be unrestrained, but some of our people will be returned to chains. I'm paraphrasing, but you get his intent. The truth is, those who blindly elect representatives, who enslave them economically, via welfare, and other entitlements, are taking away the opportunities that are available, here only in America.

He was born in Hawaii and no one noticed or cared. He moved to Indonesia and no one noticed or cared. He attended Islamic schools and no one noticed or cared. He moved back to Hawaii and spent an inordinate amount of time smoking drugs and skipping class and no one noticed or cared. He somehow, with his lack of attendance in HS and his drug use, got into college, and no one noticed or cared. Again, we don't know how, but he got into Harvard and no one noticed or cared. If fact the media is having a hard time finding anyone that even knew him in college. He got elected to the Illinois legislature and again, no one notice or cared and apparently neither did he. He got elected to the US Senate and no one noticed or cared...until he surprisingly decided to run for President. Now we notice and we care a lot because this man has made fools of those that voted for him and is in the process of destroying our economy and country. Now we care.

Message.Title: Polls Moving Towards Romney, Dems in Panic
Message.Msg: Despite the Dems declaration, Ryan is what we hoped for. No one is really believing that. The Obama Machine was frozen like a deer in the headlights. It took several days before they even had anything to say. It is somewhat true, not everyone is familiar with Ryan. But, Mitt's rallies are getting bigger, and bigger. And the crowd likes what they hear. Those over 55 are relieved, they know now, that they can count on their SS,and medicare. BARRY WAS GOING TO MAKE SS, NEEDS BASED. Translation, redistribution of your wealth. Confiscate your SS, and give it to some poor, illegal. Someone who popped over the border last week. God Bless the Romney-Ryan Team. Regime change is just a couple weeks away.
